channel.title: Data Analytics Portfolio on Sagar Kapoor
channel.description: Recent content in Data Analytics Portfolio on Sagar Kapoor

item.title: BNPL Loan Prediction with Interpretable Models
item.description: This project delves into the world of loan prediction, specifically focusing on the burgeoning "Buy Now, Pay Later" (BNPL) phenomenon. The explosion of BNPL options has ignited concerns about responsible credit practices and potential debt accumulation. By leveraging machine learning models, we investigate the factors influencing loan outcomes in a BNPL context. The project not only predicts loan success or failure but also utilizes techniques like SHAP to understand the "why" behind model decisions. Comparing Decision Tree and Random Forest models, we aim to identify

item.title: Orders Data Analysis with Python and SQL
item.description: This project explores, analyzes, and derives insights from an orders dataset. It utilizes Python (Pandas) for data manipulation and cleaning, the Kaggle API for data acquisition, and SQL Server for data storage and querying.

item.title: Prediction of Global Video Game Sales
item.description: This is a project I did for my masters research paper, where I build a recommendation system for a movies dataset. The main reason behind carrying out this research was to understand how big tech companies recommend items to its users, companies like Amazon, Netflix, Spotify and many more use recommendation systems to recommend items to its users on a daily basis. Overview Recommendation system work on the principal of “homophily” which means similar users prefer similar items, this means that companies are able to accurately predict which users is most likely to buy something / watch something.
